summary_reasoning: Key drivers are stated and numerically specific (revenue CAGR, margin trajectory, WACC inputs, terminal growth, EPS path), which supports explicitness and specificity. However, justification is weak: revenue growth nods to FY25 guidance, but margin expansion to 48%, terminal growth of 4%, and especially an 8.5% WACC (with rf 7%, ERP 6%, beta 1.1) lack reconciliation to history, peers, or a coherent capital structure. Sensitivity analysis is effectively absent; the report offers no quantified scenarios or ranges on major levers (revenue growth, margins, WACC, terminal growth) or their valuation impact, only a generic “20% valuation swing,” failing the stress-test criterion. Internal consistency is compromised by at least two contradictions: (1) the fair value “implying 22x FY26 EPS” conflicts with the report’s own FY26 EPS ($23.0), which would equate to ~17.4x at a $400 target; and (2) a net-cash balance sheet implies WACC should approximate COE (~13.6% from the report’s own rf/ERP/beta inputs), not 8.5%, absent substantial cheap debt weighting. Several material assumptions are missing or opaque (tax rate, capex/working capital, share count trajectory), and some sources are flagged as “insufficient data.” Given contradictions and lack of driver-level sensitivities, the assumptions quality is poor under the stated decision rules.

assumptions_extracted.quote: Our discounted cash flow model projects revenue CAGR of 10% from FY25 to FY29, driven by 12% growth in Digital Media and 8% in Digital Experience
Operating margins are forecasted to expand from 35% in FY24 to 48% by FY29
We apply a WACC of 8.5%, incorporating a 7% risk-free rate, 6% equity risk premium, and beta of 1.1.
EPS bridge starts from FY24 estimated $18.00… yielding FY29 EPS of $32.00.
offset by $0.50 in higher taxes and share dilution

contradictions.description: Target multiple claim conflicts with provided EPS: $400 implies ~17.4x FY26 EPS ($23.0), not 22x.
locations: Fair Value and Profit Drivers ("implying 22x FY26 EPS")

contradictions.description: WACC 8.5% inconsistent with stated rf 7%, ERP 6%, beta 1.1 (COE ~13.6%) and net cash balance sheet (WACC should approximate COE).
locations: Fair Value and Profit Drivers (WACC inputs)

unjustified_parameters: WACC 8.5% without reconciling to rf/ERP/beta and capital structure
Operating margin peak 48% without historical/peer support
